title: Animal census completed at cost of just Rs. 2.7 Mn - Ministry
byline: Sri Lanka’s first-ever nationwide animal census has been successfully completed at a total cost of just Rs. 2.7 million, the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation announced yesterday.

title: Animal cruelty still punishable by Rs.100 fine
byline: The Animal Welfare Coalition (AWC) has raised concerns over the outdated legal framework governing animal cruelty offences in Sri Lanka, calling for swift legislative reforms to better protect animals.

title: Tarinda leads depleted side against Korea
byline: Sri Lanka is set to begin their journey toward qualification for the 2027 Rugby World Cup with a crucial home fixture against South Korea tomorrow at the Racecourse ground in Colombo.

title: CSE ends mixed due to subdued trading activity
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed the day on a mixed note, with overall investor activity remaining relatively subdued. Both market turnover and share volume declined in comparison to recent sessions, which had experienced heightened trading activity.

title: India extends financial support for Nagapattinam-Kankesanthurai ferry service
byline: The Government of India has extended its financial assistance for another year to support the ongoing passenger ferry service between Nagapattinam and Kankesanthurai, reaffirming its commitment to enhancing regional connectivity and strengthening people-to-people ties with Sri Lanka, the Indian High Commission announced.

title: Man on seat 11A miraculously walks out after deadly Air India crash
byline: Ramesh Vishwaskumar Bucharvada, who was among the passengers onboard the Air India flight AI171, miracalously survived the deadly accident today.

title: COVID-19 situation under control despite rise in respiratory illnesses
byline: Health authorities have confirmed that the COVID-19 situation in the country remains under control despite a noticeable increase in respiratory illnesses being reported in recent weeks.

title: Sri Lanka continuously maintains aviation safety standards - official
byline: Sri Lanka always maintains the highest possible standards of aviation safety in accordance with the guidelines stipulated by the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) which is a specialized United Nations agency which helps 193 countries to cooperate together and share their skies to their mutual benefit, an official said.

title: Dressage Olympian suspended for repeatedly whipping horse
byline: Australian Olympian Heath Ryan has been suspended by Equestrian Australia after a video emerged that appeared to show him repeatedly whipping a horse.

title: Govt has forgotten pledge for justice over Easter attacks: Cardinal
byline: The present government has seemingly forgotten its pledge to establish a special prosecution office to bring those responsible for the Easter Sunday bomb attacks to justice, Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith said.

title: Israel strikes Iran nuclear facilities, missile factories
byline: Israel said it targeted Iran’s nuclear facilities, ballistic missile factories and military commanders on Friday at the start of what it warned would be a prolonged operation to prevent Tehran from building an atomic weapon.

title: Air India AI-171 crash one of the rarest in aviation history - Aviation experts
byline: The Air India flight crash which claimed over 250 lives in Ahmedabad yesterday is one of the rarest in aviation history as initial investigations revealed that the crash may have been due to dual engine failure, aviation experts said.

title: Plane crashes in Ahmedabad: More than 290 feared dead
byline: At least 290 people are feared to have died after a plane bound for London crashed into a residential area shortly after taking off from an airport in India’s western city of Ahmedabad.

title: Iranian state media confirms killing of Revolutionary Guards chief in Israeli strike
byline: Iranian state media confirms the killing of Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps Commander Hossein Salami in an Israeli strike.

title: Former Army Commander General Hamilton Wanasinghe passes away
byline: Former Sri Lanka Army Commander General Hamilton Wanasinghe has passed away at the age of 91, family sources confirmed today.

title: Iran Leader vows harsh retaliation after Israeli airstrikes assassinate top military commanders
byline: In a public message, Ayatollah Khamenei condemned the “criminal act” and said the Israeli regime had exposed its “malicious nature” by striking civilian areas.

title: Air India flight makes emergency landing in Thailand after bomb threat; all passengers off plane
byline: An Air India flight from Phuket in Thailand to India’s capital New Delhi received an onboard bomb threat on Friday and made an emergency landing on the island, airport authorities said.

title: Opposition secures Udu Dumbara Pradeshiya Sabha
byline: The Opposition managed to secure the Udu Dumbara Pradeshiya Sabha today, the Opposition Leader’s office said.

title: IMF praises Sri Lanka’s reform progress, nearing next tranche of funding
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has commended Sri Lanka for making significant strides in implementing tough but necessary economic reforms, bringing the country closer to receiving the next tranche of IMF financial assistance.

title: SriLankan Airlines adjusts European flight routes amid Middle East tensions
byline: The SriLankan Airlines said today it has been compelled to make changes to its European routes, including London due to escalating tensions in the Middle East to avoid the conflict zone.

title: Oil soars more than 6% after Israel’s strike on Iran alarms market
byline: June 13 (Reuters) - Oil prices jumped more than $4 a barrel on Friday, hitting their highest price in almost five months after Israel struck Iran, dramatically escalating tensions in the Middle East and raising worries about disrupted oil supplies.

title: PM Modi visits Ahmedabad plane crash site, meets lone survivor at hospital
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Ahmedabad on Friday and visited the site of the Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crash that killed 241 people a day earlier, one of the worst air disasters in recent times.

title: Iran’s military chief Bagheri killed in Israeli strike
byline: The chief of Iran’s military, Mohammad Bagheri, was killed in an Israeli strike, Iran’s semi-official Fars news agency reports.

title: Israeli military says Iran launched over 100 drones at Israel in past few hours
byline: Israel’s military says Iran is launching drones in retaliation for its strikes on Terhan.

title: Generator at Norochcholai to be shut for maintenance
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said the third generator at the Norochcholai coal power plant will be shut down for maintenance from midnight today (June 13).

title: Family’s ‘one-way journey’ to London ends in tragedy; Sri Lanka trip remembered in grief
byline: In yet another soul-crushing story that left many heartbroken after the London-bound Air India flight crashed with 242 lives onboard, a ‘one-way journey’ of a beautiful family of 5 ended up in a tragedy.

title: The miracle of seat 11A and the tragedy of seat 11J: Two British brothers boarded Air India flight but only one left alive
byline: The British brother of the only man to survive Air India’s devastating plane crash is today pictured by MailOnline as their family weeps with joy and dread.

title: No criminal offence in sugar tax reduction in 2020: CID tells court
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today that the Attorney General has concluded that no criminal offense had occurred in the process of reducing the special commodity levy on imported sugar from Rs. 50 to 25 cents per kilogram, a decision made four years ago.

title: Ranil expresses concern over economic implications of conflict in Middle East
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe expressed concern over the current government’s lack of preparedness for a potential conflict in the Middle East.

title: Israel’s main airport is closed, airlines canceling flights due to escalation in the region
byline: With Ben Gurion Airport closed to arrivals and departures until further notice, after Israel launched a major offensive against Iran and its nuclear program overnight, individual airlines are starting to issue notices of cancellation.

title: President invites German investors to explore new opportunities in tourism sector
byline: Highlighting the new investment opportunities emerging in Sri Lanka’s tourism industry, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake extended an open invitation to German investors to explore and participate in tourism-related ventures in the country.

title: Keep sick children at home amid surge in viral infections: Pediatrician
byline: Health authorities urge parents to refain from sending children exhibiting symptoms of Dengue, Chikungunya or influenza, to preschool or school, Lady Ridgeway Hospital (LRH) Consultant Pediatrician Dr. Deepal Perera said.

title: Sole survivor of Air India crash recounts final moments of doomed flight
byline: The British survivor of the Air India plane crash has described the horror of watching people “dying in front of my eyes”.

title: CSE declines following geopolitical tensions in middle east
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed the day on a negative note, following a major military strike launched by Israel on multiple military and nuclear sites across Iran. This geopolitical escalation led to heightened investor caution, contributing to a broad-based decline in the market throughout the trading session.

title: Sri Lanka calls for restraint amid rising tensions between Israel and Iran
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has expressed deep concern over the escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, calling on both nations to prioritize diplomacy and dialogue to ease the situation.

title: Iran condemns Israeli airstrikes
byline: Iran has strongly condemned what it described as a “criminal and aggressive” airstrike by the Israeli government in the early hours of Friday, which targeted multiple locations including residential areas in Tehran and other cities.

title: Medicine shortages continue to strain Sri Lanka’s healthcare system
byline: The country’s healthcare system is facing mounting pressure as shortages of essential medicines persist across government hospitals and central storage facilities.

title: Cummins eighth Australian to 300 Test wickets
byline: Cummins’ 6 for 28 in the second innings of the WTC final was also the best figures by a Test captain at Lord’s.

title: SC orders to address overcrowding at Anuradhapura Central College
byline: The Supreme Court yesterday directed the Ministry of Education to increase the number of classrooms in order to resolve the issue of student overcrowding at Anuradhapura Central College, which has a negative impact on the quality of education.

title: NPP claims chairmanship of Medawachchiya PS, SLPP secures deputy post
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has secured the post of Chairman of the Medawachchiya Pradeshiya Sabha, while the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) claimed the Deputy Chairman position following a vote held today.

title: Court issues restraining order over defamation against MP Mujibur
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali today issued a conditional restraining order against Pradeep Charles, Chairman of the United National Self-Employed Traders’ Association and a former member of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), along with several others, over allegedly defamatory and derogatory statements made against Parliamentarian Mujibur Rahuman and published online.

title: Rainfall over 100mm likely in several areas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a weather advisory forecasting showers at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern, and North-Western provinces.
